name: Eurostars Das Artes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel because the hotel was rated as nr1. in Porto at Tripadvisor. The hotel was sterile, front desk service impersonal and the rooms couldn't be more average. We were looking for something special but this really wasn't it.
reviews.title: Average hotel with backyard views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is clean and they have parking which is a bonus because parking places are really hard to find. The location is ok and there are few cafés nearby. The breakfast is not included in the price.
reviews.title: Stylish with a good location

likes.disliked: — Problems in accepting my voucher regarding breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you prefer a hotel room which could be find anywhere in the world from one of the chain hotels, this is a place for you. If you are looking for something special I would recommend to keep looking.
reviews.title: Nice, modern and clean. Free Internet and free parking.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located in the city center, not more than 15 minutes walking from Aliados, and there is several bus stops nearby. Just be sure to get the line map of Porto's public transport, or you are lost... I got a map in the reception.
reviews.title: Great small hotel with huge beds and lovely bathrooms

likes.liked: — Friendly, informed staff, large clean rooms, huge luxury bathroom, decor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was really nice. We were two adults and a girl aged 11. Even with an extra bed, the room was spacey enough.
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Quiet and convenient this lovely hotel is within walking distance of the Port and City. The hotel staff are friendly and helpful and the room is well appointed and very clean. The buffet breakfast is superb with a good selection of appetising food to choose from that is constantly being replenished.The hotel is amidst local cafes and restaurants and handy to the supermarket.We found the Airport bus cheap for airport transfers and bus stop close to hotel (near Santo Antonio Hospital).There is a delightful Art Gallery (DaVinci) a couple of doors down from the hotel which is well worth a look and if you ask for Andre he speaks good english and can tell you about the various exhibiting artists!
reviews.title: Modern hotel in great location

likes.liked: — Hotel location/outdoor tables and seating in garden setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This is a 4/5* Hotel at 3* prices.
reviews.title: Pure Class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Everything about this hotel is superb, from the modern room/breakfast/free internet/helpful staff
reviews.title: Not bad, but in an awful location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Whilst it may be a 15min walk to the waterfront this makes up for in quality.
reviews.title: Cute modern hotel

likes.liked: — The room decoration and it size

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is only 5euros should you want a taxi
reviews.title: A Good Hotel if You can Find it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a standard european hotel. The rooms have all the basics but lacked any charm (2 orange cushions and an orange chair do not make a room into anything unique) and the plumbing was noisy with pipes humming when other guests ran baths and flushed toilets. Our room was in the original part of the hotel and I suspect that the rooms in the modern block at the rear may be more special. The hotel is located about a 15 minute walk from the central tourist attractions and the area is mixed with a few designer shops but many more shabby boarded up properties, I would not have felt safe in this area on my own after dark. If I was visiting Porto again I would choose a more central location and forget paying a premium for a 'designer' hotel.
reviews.title: Ordinary Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed here with my parents at the start of a trip to Northern Portugal.Its perfectly fine for a city hotel.The rooms are clean and nicely decorated.Do a B and B deal as it works out much cheaper that way.There is a bar but its really just a corner of recepetion.It has private secure parking which I thought was great for 10 euros a night.
reviews.title: good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: My only issue was that we found it really hard to find even with Sat Nav the directions on the hotel website are useless and it was pretty charecterless but other than that it was ok.
reviews.title: Clean, very modern hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This hotel is of a very good quality and at 105 euros per night including breakfast good value. It is quite a walk to the centre, but interesting. We purchased a 3 day Porto Card which included all bus,tram and metro journeys, discounts at most museums and places of interest for only 15 euros including a phone card, very good value. It is then possible to catch a bus from the hospital to the centre and from the centre to the Ribeiro and across the river to the port lodges at which we had an extremely pleasant afternoon.
reviews.title: Excellent stay - recommended

likes.disliked: — Bathroom toiletries limited - you should take your own shampoo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Dont bother with the Port Wine museum(poor) catch the free bus just over the bridge to Grahams , the tour here was very informative and the free tasting was excellent.
reviews.title: Lovely stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think that "nice" would be the proper word to describe the " Das Artes". It's everything you might expect a 4 stars hotel. The "nice" have 3 exceptions:
reviews.title: Nice hotel, not too central though

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - The buffet breakfast is very nice
reviews.title: Very Nice Modern Hotel- a bit away from the historic area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - The hotel have no fitness center which is not nice
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010
reviews.text: - The hotel is located relatively out of the center which is also not so nice. (my wife and I are quite a walkers so if we say "our of the center" we mean it).
reviews.title: Corporate style hotel at good price, OK location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Apart of that, it's a good value.
reviews.title: Nice place - a little too far out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night at this pretty hotel. It had a comfortable bed, stylish room, and a beautiful dining room. Wonderful breakfast buffet and service. Located not far from downtown (walking distance or close to bus/train). Would stay here again.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel and best breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Within 2 minutes walk, there is a fabulous churrasqueira as well as a vegetarian cafe.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel, excellent staff in gentrifying location
Great Value, Fantastic Hotel in "Old Porto"
reviews.text: Hello,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the hotel for 4 nights in one of the larger rooms and were very comfortable. the restaurant recommendations were excellent and the staff very knowledgeable.
reviews.title: Great and pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a pleasure and easy eating in Portugal.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel In Porto!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from 5 nights staying at this hotel. The service from staff was excellent - helping us to print our return flight tickets etc - rooms were clean. The only downside was it was a 25 minute walk to the riverfront where we spent most of our time and about 10 minutes to the nearest metro station so if we returned to Porto we would stay somewhere more central.
reviews.title: Poor location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ok location, very tidy, well kept rooms, nice size.
reviews.title: very relaxed place to stay

likes.liked: — size of room and helpful staff
likes.disliked: — lack of staff in bar - often they were servign the business set in finctions and looking after the small bar so we had ot wait a whle to get served.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: friendly staff - both our bags didnt show up for 3 days and the staff really helped by phoning the airport a few times a day for updates which really saved us some time and hassle.
reviews.title: 3rd visit, just as good as 1st!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we booked a romantic room and arrived back after our first night out to fizzy wine and a fruit platter - on the house, so book a romatic room for this freebie!
reviews.title: Excellent location and value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: breakfast was in a nice seting and there was plenty of choice.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel due to the location and reviews on TripAdvisor. The hotel is modern and the rooms were amazing comfortable. We had a room in the backside of the hotel with a small balcony. The staff were quite friendly and helpful. The breakfast each morning was extensive with breads, meats, cheeses, cereal, pastries, yogurt, fruit, juices, coffee, etc. There is a small charge for parking 12 euros, but it is in an enclosed secure area next to the hotel. To walk to the river takes about 20 minutes. There are two ways to walk to the river. One way is to go by all the historical buildings, which is beautiful. If you take this route the walk down to the river is quite steep and returning this way can be difficult. Then there is another way to walk to the river by going straight down the street the hotel is on and taking another street to the river. There is only one small area that is a little steep and it makes the return walk to the hotel much easier. Porto is a beautiful city and if you stay at this hotel it will make your experience even better.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, Staff & Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Take this review with a grain of salt... Although we paid for the room, we never actually stayed in the room.
reviews.title: Dissappointing and slightly deceptive customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Due to the Icelandic volcano, a number of airports in Portugal were closed on the day we were scheduled to fly from Portugal including Porto. Therefore, we only booked a hotel at the last minute as we were stepping onto our plane. We were a bit surprised to find that many hotels with Porto had a 48 hour cancellation policy but did not have a special policy to deal with flight disruptions caused by the volcano.
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay at a very welcoming hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We reserved the Eurostars Das Artes specifically because it did not have a 48 hour cancellation policy.
reviews.title: A fantastic hotel with fantastic staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the end, our flight was diverted to Lisbon due to the ash. As soon as we arrived, we canceled our hotel in Porto and booked a hotel in Lisbon.
reviews.title: Clean & efficient if a little away from the action for tourists

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Very pleasant stay in this hotel - staff were fantastic and the room excellent. Some small cafes/bistros in the immediate area were well worth a visit (very cheap, friendly and full of locals). Small supermarket right next to the hotel is also handy for buying water etc. The breakfasts in the hotel were great - huge selection of freshly prepared food (both hot and cold). I would have no problem in recommending this hotel to anyone. And of course Porto is a really beautiful city with lots of character.
reviews.title: Nice hotel despite the big climb from the banks of the Duoro

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010
reviews.text: Some minor negative points: No wireless internet access in the rooms but they do provide cables free of charge (although these seem to available on a first come first served basis). Very steep 20-25 minute climb up from the Duoro river (where all the nightlife is) - not suitable for anyone with a health condition. However the taxis were plentiful and fairly cheap (about 5 euro for that journey). There are no big green areas near the hotel (at least not that I could see).
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great staff, slightly odd location but central.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Really enjoyed the stay at das Artes. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful despite the occassional language barrier (both ways). The room was pleasant and quiet. The hotel was in an odd spot a few blocks from town centre but very near the Soares dos Reis museum around the corner and a few blocks from Clerigos tower. ok connection by tram/bus but a slight hike from the metro (Trindade).
reviews.title: Would recommend to anyone

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We'd booked for a short break and because of ash had to stay longer. Easy Jet were absolutely useless, completely unhelpful - a real contrast to this hotel, who were helpful, kind and really condiderate. The staff were lovely - without exception - informative condiderate and friendly and they smiled! The rooms were clean and comfortable and well maintained. Showers hot, breakfast fresh and tasty. We really appreciated this lovely hotel, which is conveniently situated. Bus stops just down the road (a 1.45 euro ride to airport - in contrast to taxis at 20plus euros and a horrible ride). Nice restaurants close. Good place - loved it.
reviews.title: Good hotel! BUT ?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a good opcion, with walking distance to the old town of porto. very nice decor, with a comteporary design and great paintings. Freindly staff, the girl from the lobby (i wish a remember her name ) very nice and help us with very good restaurant recomendantion. They offer free intenet in the room , but in our room the conextion was at small bedside table with no space only for the table lamp ,so you need to put the computer on that corner of the bed , for us, non sence, because they have small desk. Also if you want to open the mini bar, that is below the desk no body can be seating at the same time, need to stand up and open. For us very uncomfortable. Otherwise was a good option.
reviews.title: PERFECT PORTO PLACE

description: For people who love art. For people who appreciate port wine and know how to enjoy it with the necessary calm. For these people we have opened the Eurostars Das Artes.The Eurostars Das Artes has a total of 89 modern, spacious rooms, equipped with high-speed Wi-Fi connections, writing desk, air conditioning, mini-bar and satellite TV. The hotel also has 4 single rooms and 3 junior suites with king-size beds and generous extra space.
